radiographic_examinations.findings: Thickening and enhancement of the proximal small-bowel walls, mild dilatation in the small bowel, a large amount of fluid in the small bowel and colon with airâ€“fluid levels, an enlarged retroperitoneal node (1.3 cm in the short axis), calcific atherosclerosis of the aorta, and a ground-glass nodule (0.7 cm in diameter) in the lower lobe of the right lung.

Erosive or exudative circumferential lesions (grade III esophagitis), excessive fluid in the gastric body, a partially obstructing duodenal ulcer (30 mm in diameter), and multiple ulcers in the second part of the duodenum.
